text: Deval Laurdine Patrick (born July 31, 1956) is an American politician. He was elected to be the governor of Massachusetts in 2006. He is the first African- American to be elected governor of that state. He is only the third African- American to be elected a governor of any state in the United States. Patrick ran as a Democrat. He was born in Chicago, Illinois on 31 July 1956, is a lawyer, and holds two degrees from Harvard University. On November 11, 2019, The New York Times reported that Patrick was thinking of a 2020 presidential candidacy. He announced his candidacy three days later on November 14. He ended his campaign on February 12, 2020 a day after the New Hampshire primary. ==References== ==Other websites== *Deval Patrick for All official presidential campaign site *Deval Patrick for Governor official campaign site *National Governors Association - Massachusetts Governor Deval Patrick biography *Transcript of Deval Patrick's acceptance speech The Boston Globe, November 8, 2006 Category:1956 births Category:Living people Category:African-American politicians Category:Governors of Massachusetts Category:2020 United States presidential candidates Category:Politicians from Chicago Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:21st-century American politicians Category:Lawyers from Chicago Category:Lawyers from Massachusetts
title: Deval Patrick
